title: How to find the length of an angle bisector when 3 sides of a triangle is given and no angle is given - Quora

response.answer_text: Taking the 3sides of the triangle ABC with sides a,b& c relating to the corresponding angles A,B, & C respectively. Constructing the angle bisector AD bisecting side BC (a) at D, as proposed by the question it is to find AD. From the theorem of angle bisector for any ∆, states to divide the corresponding base of the angle bisected as in the ratio of the two adjacent sides of the ∆.Hence for the angle A side BC (a ) is divided by AD ,the angle bisector , in ratios equivalent of AB & BC. So c:a= BD:CD BD+CD =BC. From which it could be computed for AD as bc-{a^2(bc)/(b+c)^2}.The derivation on hand note below.
